2094.subject: JAPN
2094.descrlong: Introduces Japanese culture, history, and geography using Japanese art forms, literature, philosophy, customs and traditions, economy, and politics. Covers family life, education, occupations, and work. Includes the infrastructure of modern Japan, the cities, homes, transportation, and rural Japan. Explores traditional cultural arts such as the tea ceremony, flower arrangements, Noh drama, music, and Matsuri. Examines contemporary culture including cinema, music, literature, and pop culture topics such as Manga and Anime. (Offered every third semester.)
